options.title: User Activity
options.description: Usage Behavior is a weekly report describing ways in which users are interacting with the web.
options.metaDescription: The state of the Firefox userbase, including user totals, usage hours, and version adoption. Use our public data to improve your Firefox support!

MAU.title: Monthly Active Users
description: Monthly Active Users (MAU) measures the number of Desktop and Mobile clients active in the past 28 days. MAU typically fluctuates over the year: dipping in the summer, around the New Year, and during major holidays.

avg_daily_usage(hours).title: Daily Usage
description: Daily Usage shows the hours spent browsing for a typical Firefox Desktop client in a typical day of use. Globally, the typical Firefox client averages around 4.5 hours of use per day.

avg_intensity.title: Average Intensity
description: Intensity shows how many days per week users use Firefox Desktop. Overall, the typical Firefox client uses the browser 3.5 days per week.

pct_new_user.title: New Profile Rate
description: New Profile Rate measures how often new Firefox Desktop profiles are created. A profile is the folder Firefox uses to store your add-ons, settings, and other customizations; essentially, your browser's identity.

We measure profiles rather than “new users” because Firefox doesn't track individuals. Profiles let us understand how the browser is used without identifying who's using it. It makes our job harder, but we think your privacy is worth it.

pct_latest_version.title: Latest Version
description: Latest Version shows the percentage of Firefox Desktop clients running the latest version of Firefox or greater (for that week). Firefox typically releases major updates roughly every 30 days and generally releases on Tuesdays.
